title: Why double cab imports at Rs.65 billion for MPs?
byline: The Daily Mirror’s front page lead story headlined ‘Govt. Considers Double Cab Imports for MPs’, in yesterday’s edition sparked a debate in Parliament with an opposition MP questioning the government’s duplicity in getting vehicles for parliamentarians at a cost of Rs.65 billion despite curtailment of other perks such as pensions for them.

title: National consumer prices down in July on lower food prices
byline: Sri Lanka’s national consumer prices fell in July from a month ago on lower food prices which more than offset the rise in non-food prices in the same month, mainly over the higher electricity and fuel prices.

title: Magnitude 7.5 earthquake hits off South American tip, no tsunami risk
byline: There was no tsunami threat after Thursday’s earthquake of magnitude 7.5 in the Drake Passage between South America and Antarctica, the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said, following its brief warning for Chilean coastal areas.

title: Ranil arrives at FCID
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) a short while ago to provide a statement regarding his official tour to London.

title: Postal workers on strike will not receive salaries: Postmaster General
byline: The salaries of postal workers currently engaged in strike action will not be paid this month, Postmaster General Ruwan Sathkumara said.

title: Suspect killed in shootout with STF in Sooriyawewa
byline: A suspect has died following a shootout with the Special Task Force (STF) in the Wewegama forest area of Sooriyawewa, Hambantota.

title: Akila Viraj appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (22) to provide a statement.

title: PTA will be abolished by early September: Minister
byline: The gazette to abolish the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) will be issued early next month, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Hearth said today.

title: Vital tests delayed due to spray shortage
byline: Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (UGIE) tests, a procedure used to visually examine the upper digestive system, has been delayed in many hospitals due to the lack of anaesthetic spray needed for the procedure.

title: Tense situation at central mail exchange amid postal strike
byline: A tense situation erupted between employees and officials at the Central Mail Exchange today while transporting a stock of postal bags.

title: Trump administration says it’s reviewing all 55 million US visa holders
byline: The United States Department of State has said that it’s reviewing the records of more than 55 million foreigners who hold valid US visas for potential revocation or deportable violations of immigration rules.

title: Were YouTubers informed of plan to arrest Ranil? Opposition MP questions
byline: A controversial question was raised in Parliament by Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake, who alleged that certain YouTubers may have been provided with advance information about a supposed plan to arrest former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Ranil arrested over personal tour to UK using public funds: Bimal
byline: ’’Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe was arrested for going on a personal tour to the UK using public funds,’’ Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: SJB’s Lihini Fernando condemns YouTuber’s remarks on Ranil’s arrest
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) member and lawyer Lihini Fernando has strongly condemned a statement made by YouTuber Sudha, who suggested that President Ranil Wickremesinghe should be mandatorily remanded if he appears before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to give a statement.

title: Vindictive and vicious govt – Navin D on RW’s arrest
byline: United National Party’s loyalist Navin Dissanayake condemned the arrest of his party leader Ranil Wickremesinghe, having been taken into police custody on Friday, for misusing state funds for his spouse’s visit.

title: Namal arrives at Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa arrived at the Fort Magistrate’s Court a short while ago in support of Ranil Wickremesinghe who was arrested today.

title: Arrest receipt of Ranil Wickremesinghe
byline: The arrest receipt given to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe following his arrest by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) indicates that he has committed offenses under the section 5(1) of the Public Property Act and sections 386, 388 of the Panel Code.

title: UNP releases official invitation by Wolverhampton University in defense of Ranil
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has officially released a copy of the invitation extended to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and his wife, Professor Maithree Wickramasinghe, by the University of Wolverhampton in September 2023, following his arrest on allegations of misusing state funds for the trip.

title: Why was Ranil Wickremesinghe arrested?
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe was arrested on Friday after being summoned to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), on misuse of state funds regarding a private overseas trip.

title: Sabry expresses strong concern over predicted arrest of Ranil
byline: Former Foreign Minister Ali Sabry expressed strong concern over the predicted arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, labelling it as “deeply troubling” and indicative of a growing trend of vindictive politics in Sri Lanka.

title: Special security program for cargo at BIA amid postal strike
byline: Aspecial security program is being developed to safeguard cargo waiting at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) due to the ongoing postal strike, Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation announced.

title: Ranil Wickremesinghe brought before Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was arrested by the CID has been brought before the Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: Arrest of Ranil – We kept our promise: Minister
byline: “Our government pledged to bring all wrongdoers before justice, regardless of the positions they held. We have kept that promise,” Minister of National Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament minutes after news of the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe was released.

title: Ranil’s arrest – First of its kind in SL history
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was arrested by the CID a short while ago, is the first former head of state to be arrested by law enforcement ever in Sri Lankan history.

title: Ranil's arrest; security tightened around Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: Security has been beefed up around the Fort Magistrate’s Court ahead of the appearance of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was arrested earlier today.

title: Revised schedule confirmed for ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup
byline: The ICC have announced a revised schedule for the upcoming ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup in India and Sri Lanka.

title: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrested
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe was arrested today by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) after arriving to record a statement over allegations of misusing state funds.

title: BASL raises alarm over rising elephant deaths: Calls for urgent legal reforms
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has written to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressing grave concern over the alarming increase in elephant deaths in the country, which it noted now ranks as the highest in the world.

title: Ranil arrives at CID
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago to provide a statement regarding his official tour to London.

title: Court rules former President’s visit was private, not official
byline: Considering the submissions presented, the Fort Magistrate stated that former President  Ranil Wickremesinghe’s visit in question was not an official trip but a private one.

title: Will see what can be done on 26th: Ruwan
byline: Indicating that the party will fight the case, United National Party (UNP) Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene said today that his party will see what could be done about party leader Ranil Wickremesinghe being remanded till August 26.

title: UNP lawyers filed a complaint against YouTuber
byline: United National Party (UNP) lawyers filed a complaint against Youtuber Sudantha Tilakasiri who uploaded a post saying former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is to be arrested and was to be remanded for 14 days.

title: Tense situation outside Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: A tense situation was reported outside the Fort Magistrate’s Court a short while ago as supporters of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe gathered following news of him being remanded.

title: Ranil Wickremesinghe remanded
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, named as a suspect in the alleged misuse of Rs. 16.6 million in government funds for a private overseas tour involving a group of ten, was today ordered to be remanded until August 26 by Colombo Fort Magistrate Nilupuli Lankapura.

title: Prison is not safe place for a former President: Ranil’s Counsel argues
byline: President’s Counsel Anuja Premaratne, appearing for former president Ranil Wickremesinghe, applied for bail.

title: How can one claim it as official visit when in reality it was private visit: Deelipa Peeris argues
byline: Opposing bail, Additional Solicitor General Dileepa Peeris told court that since the charges were under the Public Property Act, granting bail required special reasons.

title: Very much looking forward to Wickremesinghe returning home shortly: Ex-Maldivian president
byline: Amidst local politicians expressing solidarity with former president Ranil Wickremesinghe, former Maldivian president Mohamed Nasheed said he is very much looking forward to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe returning home shortly.

title: Ranil’s lawyers inform court his wife battles cancer, he is sole caretaker
byline: As the case against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe unfolded at the Fort magistrate’s court today, his lawyers informed court that his wife Prof. Maithree Wickremesinghe was suffering from cancer, and he was the only one there to look after her.

title: Daily Mirror Brief: Daily News Recap, Top Headlines & Must-Read Stories - 22nd August
byline: Daily Mirror Brief is your daily news digest—bringing you the top headlines, key updates, and essential stories you may have missed across politics, tech, culture, and global affairs. Quick, clear, and curated—your trusted news recap, whenever you’re ready.

title: UK, Sri Lanka sign bilateral debt agreement
byline: British High Commissioner Andrew Patrick and Sri Lanka’s Secretary to the Ministry of Finance Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma signed a bilateral debt agreement between the UK and Sri Lanka at the Ministry of Finance Planning and Economic Development today.

title: Coal company chairman cannot escape probe by resigning: FLSP
byline: An immediate investigation must be launched into the chairman of the opposition-linked coal company, as he cannot be absolved of responsibility merely by resigning from his post, Education Secretary of the Front Line Socialist Party (FLSP) Pubudu Jayagoda said.

title: Ranil’s case: Power restored
byline: The power supply in the court room where the case of former president Ranil Wickremesinghe is being taken up has been restored.

title: Sajith raises concerns over YouTuber predicting Ranil’s arrest
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) leader Sajith Premadasa said if the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe was planned as a YouTuber predicted, it is a sad day where something as sacred as law and order is reduced to cheap theatrics.

title: Power cut delays verdict in Ranil’s case
byline: A power cut in court delayed the delivery of the order in former president Ranil Wickremesinghe’s case for another 30 minutes.

title: Ranil’s case: Court in recess for 30 minutes
byline: The Fort Magistrate’s Court has gone into recess for 30 minutes during the ongoing hearing against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Another petition filed challenging Indo-Lanka Digital Identity deal
byline: National Freedom Front (NFF) leader and former Parliamentarian Wimal Weerawansa has filed a Fundamental Rights petition before the Supreme Court challenging the Cabinet decision to implement the Sri Lanka Unique Digital Identity (SLUDI) Programme, which is funded through a grant from the Government of India.

title: ’Don’t worry, I’ll control the situation’: Ranil tells crowd gathered at court
byline: ’’Don’t worry I’ll control the situation,’’ former President Ranil Wickremesinghe was heard telling the crowd that gathered at the Fort Magistrate’s Court when he was brought there.
